reviews.text: We went to this hotel as part of a large group of people (54), most of us had some issues with the rooms. Ours was on the smaller side, three single beds crammed in with just enough room to walk past each bed. Wallpaper peeling of the walls, holes in the wall from coat hooks, sockets that could not be used as they pushed through into the cavity, plus the sockets required a three pin adapter before you use your european adapter! The main light above the large mirror on the wall also failed to work. The heating in the room was just good enough to take the chill off the room, which was of no use as the window was permenantly open and could not be closed. Although there was a notice on the window telling you not to open the window as it is a maintenance window. We were not alone with these complaints. The location of the hotel seemed strange too, very difficult to find a decent restaurant or shops, next door is a restaurant with pizzeria written above the door but they told us that they do not sell pizza. They did manage to feed all 54 of us with plates of antipasti, pasta and fried fish, with plenty of wine. So hats off to them for that. Food at the hotel was ok, but it was nothing compared to the photo's supplied on the web site. This hotel also appeared to be short staffed, as the Guy serving Breakfast also served dinner and we also saw him running the bar, which was completely under stocked and rarely open. The last thing to remember is not to leave your passport with them as this is placed behind the reception counter and not kept in a secure place. The counter is not continually staffed. The Hotel staff did try to be helpfull and it was clean and tidy. My title for the review says it all. I hope I never return to this Hotel!!

reviews.text: Considering that you are paying a double room €50 with breakfast included,this is a very convenient option if you are going or arriving from the airport. We arrived quite late at night, had no problem in finding the hotel since a huge neon sign is located on the top. No problem for the parking, and the centre of Cagliari is at ten minutes driving. The rooms we were given on the second floor were ok and perfectly clean. We enjoyed a good sleep, no noise at all but in the morning the curtains didn't prevent the light from coming in. Breakfast was average. As other many guest I didn't appreciate they charged the entire amount in advance.Staff was corteous but made a mistake with the reservations: when I confirmed my two rooms I was told to that they had three and asked me to sort out the issue with expedia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although initially a little difficult to find, we were accorded a warm welcome. I notice that another reviewer said 'They speak mostly Italian' - that is because they are Italian!! We both speak Italian, but, I'm sure, with a little effort to learn a few words ( we British are notoriously lazy at learning foreign languages) one could get by. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Not the most wonderful area of the city, but within 10 minutes drive of the Via Roma and the Castello district. The staff were very helpful, and gave us a map with very clear instructions as to how to reach the main parts of the city. We didn't use the restaurant for our evening meal, as it was usually a fixed menu, but the breakfasts were of good quality, with plenty of variety. There is a car park which is guarded from 5pm. through the night, albeit at 5 Euros per night, but we thought well worth the expense.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel 'Alliance' at short notice, moving on from Nice. I would not recommend it for weekenders or holidaymakers. We got there by our hire car and it would have been unfindable if we didn't have our iphone sat nav - as they'd taken down the hotel signage so it was a pretty anonymous looking building off the 'motorway'. The hotel is nice enough, clean, comfortable, staff were very nice etc but it's more of a business hotel i would say, and it is right next to a motorway so lots of noise from that if you have the window open. We had a nightmare when we got a taxi to the beachfront for a meal and drinks - when we got in a taxi to come back none of the taxi drivers knew where our hotel was so it was quite an adventure trying to get back (as the previous reviewer says it is also known as the 'Joly Hotel' and the 'Hotel Cagliari' so just bear that in mind - or stay in a hotel down by the beach/old town...
